mainHeading: SomniSage: Sleep Stage Scoring and personalized intervention system.
context: College capstone project aimed at improving automated sleep stage classification and supporting personalized treatment strategies using deep learning on physiological signal data.
objectives: Researched sleep stage subtyping using Siamese and CNN-BiLSTM models
Trained models on a multi-channel PSG dataset with 2688 features from EEG, EMG, and EOG signals
Achieved up to 84.5% accuracy in classifying sleep stages
Explored how deep learning can support diagnosis and intervention in sleep disorders
Enhanced signal interpretation for better medical insights
features: Developed Siamese and CNN-BiLSTM models for temporal pattern recognition
Used time-series preprocessing on raw EEG, EMG, and EOG data
Integrated TensorFlow-based training pipeline with cross-validation
Improved classification performance through feature engineering and normalization
Currently exploring a knowledge graph extension to model interrelations between sleep stages, disorders, and interventions
